title: Ralph Lauren just released a new collection inspired by Rachel from ‘Friends’
text:
caption The new collection from Ralph Lauren features a line of workwear inspired by Jennifer Aniston’s character from “Friends.” source x

It’s been 25 years since “Friends” hit our TV screens, but Jennifer Aniston’s character, Rachel Green, is still making waves when it comes to her iconic style.

Ralph Lauren just released his latest collection in partnership with Warner Bros. Consumer Products, with pieces inspired by Rachel and her devotion to the Ralph Lauren brand on the show.

The collection includes wool and pinstriped suits, turtlenecks, and luxurious velvet, fur, and shearling jackets perfect for the fall season.

Fans can also celebrate the “Friends” 25th anniversary and shop the collection on Saturday and Sunday at Bloomingdale’s 59th Street flagship location in New York, where the retailer’s Studio 59 space has been transformed into a replica of the show’s famous Central Perk coffee shop- complete with the iconic orange couch.

Visit Business Insider’s homepage for more stories.

If you grew up watching “Friends” and always wanting to replicate Rachel Green’s effortlessly chic style, hold on to your plaid miniskirt, because we have some exciting news.

The iconic American designer Ralph Lauren has released his latest collection, inspired by the “Friends” 25th anniversary and Jennifer Aniston’s character.

The new collection – made in partnership with Warner Bros. Consumer Products – features pieces heavily inspired by the looks Aniston wore on the show as Rachel, including but not limited to plaid trousers, chic blazers, and silk blouses.

The collection is available at an immersive pop-up shop inspired by “Friends” at Bloomingdale’s 59th Street flagship location in New York, which also holds special significance on the show: The retailer gave Rachel her first big fashion job, before she went on to work at Ralph Lauren.

Read more: Inside the ‘Friends’ pop-up that sold out in 3 hours, where you can order from Central Perk and wear Monica’s turkey head

In the retailer’s Studio 59 space on Saturday and Sunday, visitors can grab a complimentary cup of joe and mill around a replica of the Central Perk coffee shop, home of the famous orange couch. Through next week, shoppers can also visit the store’s third floor to check out a replica of Rachel’s Bloomingdale’s office.

The installations will also travel across the country to Bloomingdale’s locations in White Plains, New York; Bergen County, New Jersey; Aventura, Florida; and Norwalk, Connecticut.

Fans of the show and Rachel’s work-ready style can shop the collection in select Ralph Lauren retail stores and on RalphLauren.com starting Wednesday.
